intro: Psychotria sonkeana, commonly known as the Congo psychotria, is a flowering plant native to Central and West Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The plant's morphology reflects its adaptation to humid tropical climates and its role in local ecosystems.
